byline.contributor: Choe Sang-Hun contributed reporting from Seoul, South Korea, and Jonathan Soble from Tokyo.

abstract: Donald J Trump's assertion that he would consider withdrawing American troops from Japan and South Korea if they refuse to spend more on military defense provokes worries in region about potential for arms race; some in Asian vehemently denounce comments, which seem to undermine mutual defense treaties.

headline.print_headline: Trump’s Plan Draws Alarm From Allies in East Asia
headline.main: Comments by Donald Trump Draw Fears of an Arms Race in Asia

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The Republican front-runner said he would consider withdrawing U.S. forces from Japan and South Korea if they did not spend more on military defense.
lead_paragraph: The Republican front-runner said he would consider withdrawing U.S. forces from Japan and South Korea if they did not spend more on military defense.
